(Founder and CEO) | industry = (VoC) and (EFM) Technology | homepage =http://www.allegiance.com/ }} '''Allegiance''' is a [[voice of customer]] (VoC) and [[enterprise feedback management]] (EFM) technology platform that lets organizations collect and analyze consumer data in real time.{{citeweb|url=http://techcrunch.com/2011/06/23/allegiance-raises-12-million-for-customer-feedback-platform//|title=Allegiance Raises $12 Million For Customer Feedback Platform|author=Leena Rao|date=June 23, 2011|publisher=Tech Crunch|accessdate= 25 June 2013 |}}{{citeweb|url=http://www.inc.com/profile/allegiance|title=Allegiance:Company Profile|publisher=Inc.|accessdate= 25 June 2013 |}}{{citeweb|url=http://blogs.forrester.com/kerry_bodine/12-12-28-the_danger_of_big_data|title=http://blogs.forrester.com/kerry_bodine/12-12-28-the_danger_of_big_data|author=Kerry Bodine|date=December 28, 2012 |publisher=Forrester Blogs|accessdate= 25 June 2013 |}} The company is recognized for providing large companies and government agencies with a range of big data mining tools, and it is listed as one of the [[General Services Administration|GSA’s]] approved vendors.{{citeweb|url=http://www.destinationcrm.com/Articles/Editorial/Magazine-Features/Listening-to-the-Voice-of-the-Constituent-83071.aspx|title=Listening to the Voice of the Constituent|author=Judith Aquino|publisher=Destination Crm|accessdate= 25 June 2013 |}} Allegiance’s clients include [[AT&T]], [[Kellogg’s]], [[Pfizer]], [[JetBlue]], the [[American Cancer Society]], and [[Dell]], and it has been ranked as one of ''[[Inc. (magazine)|Inc.]]'' magazine’s fastest-growing companies.{{citeweb|url=http://www.allegiance.com/company/about-allegiance|title=About Allegiance|accessdate= 25 June 2013 |}} The company is headquartered in [[South Jordan, Utah |South Jordan, UT]], and Adam Edmunds is its founder and CEO.{{citeweb|url=http://www.allegiance.com/company/leadership-team|title=Leadership Team |accessdate= 25 June 2013 |}}{{citeweb|url=http://www.sltrib.com/sltrib/money/54651573-79/allegiance-customer-company-feedback.html.csp?page=1|title=Allegiance helps build loyalty with customers|author=Tom Harvey|date=August 11,2012|publisher=The Salt Lake Tribune|accessdate= 25 June 2013 |}} ==History== Allegiance was founded in 2005 when the ethics compliance firm SilentWhistle merged with Allegiance Technologies, a provider of online feedback tools. Adam Edmunds founded the company to provide organizations with more advanced tools for analyzing customer data in real time.{{citeweb|url=http://www.destinationcrm.com/Articles/Editorial/Magazine-Features/Listening-to-the-Voice-of-the-Customer-83180.aspx|title=Listening to the Voice of the Customer|author=Leonard Klie|publisher=Destination Crm|accessdate= 25 June 2013 |}} In 2009, Allegiance acquired Inquisite, a provider of online survey software. In 2012, the company raised $12 million in a Series B round of venture financing, which included investors El Dorado Ventures, Rembrandt Venture Partners, and Allegis Capital.{{citeweb|url=http://www.sltrib.com/sltrib/money/52065286-79/allegiance-funding-million-software.html.csp|title=Allegiance raises $12 million in funding|date=June 23,201|publisher=The Salt Lake Tribune|accessdate= 25 June 2013 |}} ==Products== Allegiance provides large organizations with tools for collecting and analyzing customer feedback and translating it into business insights in real-time. The company’s flagship product, the Engage platform, is a feedback management platform that generates “Customer Intelligence” by drawing insights from multiple channels a client organization uses to connect with customers.{{citeweb|url=http://www.allegiance.com/products/the-engage-platform|title=The Engage Platform |accessdate= 25 June 2013 |}} The Engage platform is used by several organizations with large customer feedback databases, including JetBlue and AT&T. The company provides several other products and services, including [[text analytics]], survey engines, online feedback forms, and [[social media]] feedback. ==Awards and recognition== Allegiance claims to have won or been nominated for several awards, including:{{citeweb|url=http://www.allegiance.com/news-and-events/awards-recognitions|title=Awards & Recognitions|accessdate= 25 June 2013 |}} * Ranked as a 2013 Service leader by CRM Magazine * Won the TMC Innovation Labs award for the Allegiance Spotlight platform in 2012 * Won the Communications Solutions Product of the Year award for the Engage platform in 2011 * CEO Adam Edmunds was selected as a finalist for the [[Ernst & Young Entrepreneur of the Year Award |Ernst & Young Entrepreneur of the Year]] in 2010 * Ranked as one of ''Inc.'' magazine’s fastest-growing companies in 2009 * Won the Communications Solutions Product of the Year award in 2009 ==External links== *http://www.allegiance.com/ ==References== {{reflist}} [[Category:Product management ]] [[Category:Management]] [[Category:Enterprise architecture]] [[Category:Survey methodology]]
